item.title: Who won the presidential debate: X or Threads?
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
There were definite differences between how the two platforms managed last night, with some saying X felt more alive, and others asserting that Threads proved that X is no longer necessary.

item.title: Following raft of consumer complaints, Shein and Temu face early EU scrutiny of DSA compliance
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Ultra low cost ecommerce giants Shein and Temu have only recently been confirmed as subject to centralized enforcement of the strictest layer of the European Union’s digital services regulation, the Digital Services Act (DSA), but on Friday the Commission announced it’s sent a bunch of requests for information (RFI) to both platforms vis-a-vis to their […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Beware the smiling robot with living skin
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Will robots ever have living, human skin? Researchers have been exploring the question and they’ve come up with some pretty unsettling results. I think it’s fair to say that no one would confuse any of today’s robots, no matter how advanced, with another human being. Even when a company like Tesla or Figure creates a […]

item.title: Cold shipping might be the next industry that batteries disrupt
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Artyc has raised $14 million to date and has a product on the market, Medstow Micro, that helps ship temperature-sensitive specimens.

item.title: Remote access giant TeamViewer says Russian spies hacked its corporate network
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The remote access giant linked the cyberattack to government-backed hackers working for Russian intelligence, known as APT29.

We’ve poked through the many product announcements made by the biggest tech companies and product trade shows of the year, so far, and compiled them into this list.

item.title: Feather raises €6M to go Pan-European with its insurance platform for expats
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
As a foreigner, navigating health insurance systems can often be difficult. German startup Feather thinks it has a solution and raised €6 million to help some of the 40-plus million expats working and living in Europe. It is not that there are no options for foreign nationals to get insurance; there are plenty. But it […]

item.title: Rohlik rolls up $170M to expand in European grocery delivery and sell its tech to others
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
The salad days of fresh grocery delivery startups are over, but those that have stayed the course, and built businesses that are seeing gains, are still here and hungry for more growth. On Friday, one of those survivors, the Czech grocery delivery company Rohlik, announced $170 million in new funding. Rohlik — which means “baker” […]

item.title: Robotics investments are gaining speed after post-pandemic slowdown
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
The first six months of the year have seen $4.2 billion invested in robotics, putting this year well on track to beat 2023’s 12-month total of $6.8 billion.

item.title: Hebbia raises nearly $100M Series B for AI-powered document search led by Andreessen Horowitz
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Hebbia, a startup using generative AI to search large documents and return answers, has raised a nearly $100 million Series B led by Andreessen Horowitz, according to three people with knowledge of the matter.  The round valued the company between $700 million and $800 million, although TechCrunch couldn’t verify whether that valuation is pre- or […]

item.title: Agility’s humanoid robots are going to handle your Spanx
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Digit’s first job will be moving totes around a Connecticut Spanx factory — which is most definitely not a euphemism.

item.title: Will AI get an A+ in edtech? MagicSchool raises $15M to find out
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
These days, when you hear about students and generative AI, chances are that you’re getting a taste of the debate over the adoption of tools like ChatGPT. Are they a help? (Yay! Great for research! Fast!) Or are they a harm? (Boo! Misinfo! Cheating!). But some startups are taking the arrival of generative AI in […]

item.title: Zuckerberg disses closed-source AI competitors as trying to ‘create God’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
In the conversation, Zuckerberg said there needs to be a lot of different AIs that get created to reflect people's different interests.

item.title: Andrew Ng plans to raise $120M for next AI Fund
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
AI big shot Andrew Ng’s AI Fund, a startup incubator that backs small teams of experts looking to solve key problems using AI, plans to raise upward of $120 million for its second effort. A filing with the SEC shows that the AI Fund’s second fund, AI Venture Fund II, has so far amassed $69.75 […]

item.title: FCC rule would make carriers unlock all phones after 60 days
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Specifically, according to the FCC, carriers would simply have to provide unlocking services 60 days after activation.

item.title: As battery startups fail, Sila snaps up $375M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Amid a fraught environment for battery startups, Sila has raised $375 million to finish construction of a U.S. factory that will scale its next-generation battery technology for customers like Mercedes-Benz and Panasonic by the end of 2025. Sila, formerly known as Sila Nanotechnologies, is slated to finish construction of its Moses Lake, Washington plant in […]

item.title: Meta starts testing user-created AI chatbots on Instagram
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced on Thursday that the company will begin to surface AI characters made by creators through Meta AI studio on Instagram. The tests will begin in the U.S. The social media company’s announcement comes on the same day as a16z-backed chatbot company Character.AI is rolling out the ability for users to […]
